column1: Preparing for a medical test or procedure can reduce anxiety, encourage cooperation, and help your adolescent develop coping skills.

Suggest ways for your adolescent to stay calm, such as: - Blowing bubbles - Breathing deeply - Counting - Creating a quiet, peaceful environment - Doing relaxation techniques (thinking pleasant thoughts) - Holding the hand of a calm parent (or someone else) during the procedure - Playing hand-held video games - Using guided imagery - Trying other distractions, such as listening to music through headphones, if allowed When possible, let your adolescent make some decisions, such as deciding the time of day or the date of the procedure.
